item.title: On local preservation of orthogonality and its application to isometries
item.description: arXiv:2407.08900v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate the local preservation of Birkhoff-James orthogonality at a point by a linear operator on a finite-dimensional Banach space and illustrate its importance in understanding the action of the operator in terms of the geometry of the concerned spaces. In particular, it is shown that such a study is related to the preservation of k-smoothness and the extremal properties of the unit ball of a Banach space. As an application of the results obtained in this direction, we obtain a refinement of the well-known Blanco-Koldobsky-Turnsek characterization of isometries on some polyhedral Banach spaces, including $ \ell_{\infty}^n, \ell_1^n. $
item.dc:creator: Debmalya Sain, Jayanta Manna, Kallol Paul

item.title: Involutivity of distributions at points of superdense tangency with respect to normal currents
item.description: arXiv:2407.09028v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let ${\mathcal D}$ and $T$ be, respectively, a $C^1$ distribution of $k$-planes and a normal $k$-current on ${\mathbf R}^n$. Then ${\mathcal D}$ has to be involutive at almost every superdensity point of the tangency set of $T$ with respect to ${\mathcal D}$.
item.dc:creator: Silvano Delladio

item.title: Band projections and order idempotents in Banach lattice algebras
item.description: arXiv:2407.09149v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Motivated by recent work about band projections on spaces of regular operators over a Banach lattice, given a Banach lattice algebra $A$, we will say an element $a \in A_+$ is a band projection if the multiplication operator $L_aR_a\in \mathcal L_r(A)$ is a band projection. Our aim in this note is to explore the relations between this and the notion of order idempotent (those elements $a$ in a Banach lattice algebra $A$ with identity $e$ such that $0\leq a\leq e$ and $a^2=a$). We also revisit the properties of the ideal generated by the identity on a Banach lattice algebra, motivated by those of the centre of a Banach lattice.
item.dc:creator: David Mu\~noz-Lahoz

item.title: Spherical Fourier multipliers related to Gelfand pairs
item.description: arXiv:2407.09225v2 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we introduce a family of Fourier multipliers using the spherical Fourier transform on Gelfand pairs. We refer to them as spherical Fourier multipliers. We study certain sufficient conditions under which they are bounded. Then, under the hypothesis of compactness of the underlying group and under certain summability conditions, we obtain the belonging of the spherical Fourier multipliers to some Schatten-von Neumann classes.
item.dc:creator: Yaogan Mensah, Marie Fran\c{c}oise Ouedraogo

item.title: Improved polynomial decay for unbounded semigroups
item.description: arXiv:2407.09323v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We obtain polynomial decay rates for $C_{0}$-semigroups, assuming that the resolvent grows polynomially at infinity in the complex right half-plane. Our results do not require the semigroup to be uniformly bounded, and for unbounded semigroups we improve upon previous results by, for example, removing a logarithmic loss on non-Hilbertian Banach spaces.
item.dc:creator: Chenxi Deng, Jan Rozendaal, Mark Veraar

item.title: Function spaces on formal manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2407.09329v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This is a paper in a series that studies smooth relative Lie algebra homologies and cohomologies based on the theory of formal manifolds and formal Lie groups. In a previous paper, we introduce the notion of formal manifolds and develop the foundational framework of formal manifolds. In this paper, we study various function spaces on formal manifolds, including generalizations of vector-valued generalized functions and vector-valued distributions on smooth manifolds to the setting of formal manifolds.
item.dc:creator: Fulin Chen, Binyong Sun, Chuyun Wang

item.title: Ultradifferentiable functions via the Laguerre operator
item.description: arXiv:2407.09422v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce spaces of test functions $\mathbf{G}^{\alpha}_{\alpha}(\mathbb R ^d_+)$ and $\mathbf{g}^{\alpha}_{\alpha}(\mathbb R ^d_+)$, $\alpha > 0$, by using the iterates of the Laguerre operator, and show that these spaces represent a natural counterpart of global Pilipovi\'c spaces on $\mathbb R ^d$. Moreover, we show that $\mathbf{G}^{\alpha}_{\alpha}(\mathbb R^d_+)$ and $\mathbf{g}^{\alpha}_{\alpha}(\mathbb R ^d_+)$ coincide with $G-$type spaces when $\alpha \geq 1$, and $\alpha > 1$, respectively. We also consider the associated spaces of ultradistributions. The main tool in our study is the use of sequence spaces $\ell_{\alpha}(\mathbb N_0 ^d)$ and $\ell_{0,\alpha}(\mathbb N_0 ^d)$ arising from the corresponding Laguerre expansions. In addition, by considering sequence spaces $ \ell_{\flat_{\sigma}}(\mathbb N^d_0) $ and $\ell_{0,\flat_{\sigma}}(\mathbb N^d_0)$, we introduce and study flat Pilipovi\'c spaces on orthants.
item.dc:creator: Smiljana Jak\v{s}i\'c, Stevan Pilipovi\'c, Nenad Teofanov, {\DJ}or{\dj}e Vu\v{c}kovi\'c

item.title: On certain extremal Banach-Mazur distances in small dimensions
item.description: arXiv:2407.08829v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the maximal possible Banach-Mazur distance for certain pairs of symmetric convex bodies. A classical consequence of the John Ellipsoid Theorem is that the Banach-Mazur distance of a symmetric convex body $K \subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$ to the $n$-dimensional Euclidean ball is not greater than $\sqrt{n}$. Equality holds in every dimension $n$ for the unit balls of $\ell_1^n$ and $\ell_{\infty}^n$, that is, for cross-polytopes and parallelotopes in dimension $n$. While it is known that in dimension $n \geq 4$, there are more convex bodies (not affinely equivalent to either of the previous two) with the distance $\sqrt{n}$ to the ball, and that for $n=2$ the parallelogram is unique, the characterization of the equality case for dimension $n=3$ seems to have never been published. We prove that the three-dimensional cross-polytopes and parallelotopes are the only symmetric convex bodies in $\mathbb{R}^3$ with the distance $\sqrt{3}$ to the Euclidean ball. Moreover, in the planar case we establish the stability of the uniqueness of the parallelogram with the best possible (linear) order of the estimate. We also consider the maximal possible Banach-Mazur distance between planar $1$-symmetric convex bodies. In this case, we prove that the maximal possible distance is $\sqrt{2}$ and characterize the equality case, which again involves a parallelogram.
item.dc:creator: Florian Grundbacher, Tomasz Kobos

item.title: Ground state decay for Schr\"odinger operators with confining potentials
item.description: arXiv:2407.09267v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give two-sided estimates of a ground state for Schr\"odinger operators with confining potentials. We propose a semigroup approach, based on resolvent and the Feynman--Kac formula, which leads to a new, rather short and direct proof. Our results take the sharpest form for slowly varying, radial and increasing potentials.
item.dc:creator: Mi{\l}osz Baraniewicz

item.title: Stochastic proof of the sharp symmetrized Talagrand inequality
item.description: arXiv:2407.09465v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a new proof of the sharp symmetrized form of Talagrand's transport-entropy inequality. Compared to stochastic proofs of other Gaussian functional inequalities, the new idea here is a certain coupling induced by time-reversed martingale representations.
item.dc:creator: Thomas A. Courtade, Max Fathi, Dan Mikulincer

item.title: Operator models for meromorphic functions of bounded type
item.description: arXiv:2401.05214v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article, we construct operator models for meromorphic functions of bounded type on Krein spaces. This construction is based on certain reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces which are closely related to model spaces. Specifically, we show that each function of bounded type corresponds naturally to a pair of such spaces, extending Helson's representation theorem. This correspondence enables an explicit construction of our model, where the Krein space is a suitable sum of these identified spaces. Additionally, we establish that the representing self-adjoint relations possess a relatively simple structure, proving to be partially fundamentally reducible. Conversely, we show that realizations involving such relations correspond to functions of bounded type.
item.dc:creator: Christian Emmel

item.title: Two-dimensional B\l{}ocki, $L^p$-Mahler, and Bourgain conjectures
item.description: arXiv:2401.10992v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We confirm, in dimension two, Blocki's conjectures on sharp lower bounds for Bergman kernels of tube domains. To that end, we verify a broader class of $L^p$-Mahler conjectures due to Berndtsson and the authors, where $p=1$ are Blocki's conjecture, and $p=\infty$ are Mahler's conjectures. The proofs are technically challenging as the $L^p$-Mahler volume is considerably harder to deal with analytically compared to Mahler's volume, and furthermore duality is lost. In addition, unlike in the classical Mahler setting, the non-symmetric setting is considerably more involved than the symmetric one. The proofs involve studying the effect of Mahler's classical sliding of vertices on two-dimensional polytopes on the $L^p$-polar body (no longer a polytope). Some arguments are inspired by works of Campi--Gronchi and Meyer--Reisner on volumes of classical polar bodies of shadow systems. In passing, we also explore how Mahler's sliding affects the isotropic constant. This leads to an elementary proof of Bourgain's strong hyperplane conjectures in dimension two, originally due to Bisztriczky--B\"or\"oczky, Campi--Colesanti--Gronchi and Meckes. Specifically, we show that, as a function of the sliding parameter, the isotropic constant raised to an appropriate power is a convex quadratic polynomial.
item.dc:creator: Vlassis Mastrantonis, Yanir A. Rubinstein

item.title: Mixed-norm Herz-type Besov-Triebel-Lizorkin spaces
item.description: arXiv:2406.14727v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Based on mixed-norm Herz spaces, Besov and Triebel-Lizorkin spaces, we introduce the so called mixed-norm Herz-type Besov-Triebel-Lizorkin spaces. We present the $\varphi $-transform characterization of these spaces in the sense of Frazier and Jawerth and we prove their Sobolev, Franke and Jawerth embeddings. Our embeddings extend and improve Sobolev, Franke and Jawerth embeddings of mixed-norm Besov and Triebel-Lizorkin spaces.
item.dc:creator: Douadi Drihem
